TITLE: Ukraine's foreign minister submits resignation as Russian strikes kill 7 in Lviv
SUMMARY: FILE - Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba speaks during joint press conference with German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock in Kyiv, Ukraine, May 21, 2024

TITLE: In Ukraine, turning air raid sirens into a piece of music
SUMMARY: People wait out an air raid alarm at the Teatralna metro station during the massive Russian drone and missile attack in Kyiv, Ukraine, on Aug. 26. Ukrinform/NurPhoto via Getty Images

TITLE: France names conservative Michel Barnier as prime minister, irking leftist vote winners
SUMMARY: Michel Barnier speaks during a campaign rally on Feb. 13, 2022, in Paris. President Emmanuel Macron named the former EU Brexit negotiator as France's new prime minister on Thursday after more than 50 days of caretaker government

TITLE: A French woman whose husband is accused of inviting men to rape her testifies in court
SUMMARY: Gisèle Pélicot (left) arrives in the Avignon court house, in Avignon, southern France, on Thursday

TITLE: U.K. is investigating Ticketmaster after Oasis tour prices surprised fans
SUMMARY: Competition and Markets Authority, a U.K. regulator, launched an investigation into how Ticketmaster priced its tickets for the Oasis reunion tour next summer and whether the company was transparent about it ahead of time

TITLE: Ukraine civilians try the army for a week
SUMMARY: Ukraine needs more soldiers as its troops defend Ukrainian territory and carry out an offensive inside Russia. An elite Ukrainian military unit offers civilians a one-week tryout as soldiers

TITLE: Alcohol-free beer is gaining popularity, even at Oktoberfest
SUMMARY: At Weihenstephan, non-alcoholic wheat beer and lager now make up 10% of the volume. The increase over the last few years mirrors the statistics for the rest of Germany's beer industry

TITLE: What the U.S. Military is Learning from the Drone War in Ukraine
SUMMARY: As the war in Ukraine drags on, the U.S. military is keeping a close eye on how drones are changing the conflict. They are used by both Russia and Ukraine to watch troop movements, identify targets and drop bombs. We go to the woods of Louisiana to see what lessons the U.S. Army is incorporating into its training and understand what it might mean for future wars

TITLE: From Gaza to Ukraine, why do so many modern wars last so long?
SUMMARY: Russia and Ukraine have fought for a decade. The Israel-Hamas war is part of a conflict dating back generations. NPR’s Greg Myre has covered both wars and looks at why they seem to defy a solution

TITLE: Something is Missing from London: Children
SUMMARY: The Hackney area of East London is burgeoning with art galleries and cafes. But the neighborhood, like many places that are appealing to young professionals, is rapidly losing families with children. And some experts say it's a bad sign for the future. We go to Hackney to understand the problem

TITLE: Poland’s foreign minister on why his country voted out its ruling far-right party
SUMMARY: Poland's foreign minister Radosław Sikorski talks to about the right-wing Law and Justice Party losing power, democracy, and support for Ukraine

TITLE: Austrian far-right party wins national vote but its chances of governing are unclear
SUMMARY: The Freedom Party on Sunday secured the first far-right national parliamentary election victory in post-World War II Austria. But political rivals have said they won’t work with the party's leader

TITLE: In a climate milestone, the U.K. — 1st to harness coal power — is among 1st to quit it
SUMMARY: The U.K. used coal power to drive the Industrial Revolution and expand the British Empire. It's now the first major economy to quit the fossil fuel, a primary contributor to global warming

TITLE: Pope names 21 new cardinals, increasing pool who will one day elect his successor
SUMMARY: Pope Francis named 21 new cardinals Sunday, significantly increasing the size of the College of Cardinals who will one day elect his successor

TITLE: Rafael Nadal announces his retirement from tennis after 22 Grand Slam titles
SUMMARY: The 38-year-old tennis legend, who has been dealing with injuries in recent years, said he will step away from the sport after next month’s Davis Cup finals

TITLE: Award-winning Ukrainian journalist dies in Russian captivity, Kyiv says
SUMMARY: Ukrainian officials on Thursday confirmed the death of freelance journalist Victoria Roshchyna, though the circumstances surrounding her death were unclear

TITLE: Moldova election is over shadowed by accusations of interference by Russia
SUMMARY: Moldova voted in favor of adding a path to the European Union to its constitution, and gave the incumbent president the most votes in elections Sunday, but neither result was the win leaders wanted

TITLE: Even in death, Alexei Navalny hasn't given up the fight against corruption in Russia
SUMMARY: , Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny wrote - "If they do finally whack me, the book will be my memorial

TITLE: Moldova’s pro-Western president wins vote overshadowed by Russian meddling claims
SUMMARY: Moldova's President Maia Sandu smiles while holding a bouquet of flowers as she celebrates with supporters the preliminary results of the presidential election runoff, in Chisinau, Moldova, Sunday, Nov. 3, 2024

TITLE: The week of devastating floods that Spaniards will never forget
SUMMARY: King Felipe VI of Spain is heckled by angry residents who throw mud and objects during his visit to Paiporta, in the region of Valencia, eastern Spain, on November 3, 2024, in the aftermath of devastating deadly floods. Manaure Quintero/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: He Escaped Russia in a Prisoner Swap. Why Did He Not Want to Be Part of It?
SUMMARY: Russian opposition politician Ilya Yashin speaks during an event with supporters at the Mauerpark in Berlin, Germany, on Aug. 7, 2024

TITLE: Germany's coalition government collapses as Chancellor Scholz fires his finance chief
SUMMARY: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz gives a statement after a meeting with government leaders in Berlin, Wednesday

TITLE: Who does Russia want in Washington?
SUMMARY: Russia's President Vladimir Putin holds an exercise of the strategic deterrence forces via a videolink at the Kremlin in Moscow on Oct. 29. Mikhail Metzel/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: International Reaction to Trump's Victory
SUMMARY: Supporters of Republican presidential nominee, former President Donald Trump during an election night watch party on Wednesday

TITLE: What will Trump's presidency mean for Russia's war on Ukraine?
SUMMARY: Then-candidate Donald Trump meets with Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at Trump Tower, on Sept. 27, in New York

TITLE: Notre Dame welcomes arrival of 3 new bells as cathedral reopening nears
SUMMARY: A bell, center, that Olympic medalists rang at the Paris Games, is seen before being installed in Notre Dame Cathedral, ahead of the monument's grandiose reopening following a massive fire and five-year reconstruction effort, Thursday, Nov. 7, 2024 in Paris

TITLE: Israeli soccer fans were attacked in Amsterdam
SUMMARY: In an image taken from video, police are seen escorting Maccabi Tel Aviv soccer team supporters to the metro station, leading them to the Ajax stadium, after pro-Palestinian supporters marched near the stadium, in Amsterdam, Thursday

TITLE: The treaty between Russia and North Korea signals a new era on 2 continents
SUMMARY: In this pool photograph distributed by the Russian state agency Sputnik, Russian President Vladimir Putin, right, and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un walk during a farewell ceremony upon Putin's departure at the Sunan International Airport in Pyongyang on June 19. Vladimir Smirnov/Pool/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Germany's Scholz discusses Ukraine with Russia's Putin in first such call in 2 years
SUMMARY: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz attends the Bundestag's Committee of Inquiry into Afghanistan, in Berlin on Nov. 14

TITLE: The great German land lottery
SUMMARY: Every ten years, a group of German farmers gather in the communal farm fields of the Osing for the , a land lottery dating back centuries

TITLE: Russia launches 'massive' attack on Ukraine energy, killing at least seven
SUMMARY: In this photo provided by the Ukrainian Emergency Service, emergency services personnel work to extinguish a fire following a Russian rocket attack in Poltava region Ukraine, Sunday, Nov. 17, 2024

TITLE: In France, a family reckons with World War II Allies' legacy of rape and murder
SUMMARY: From left: Michelle Salaün, Jeannine Plassard and Marie-Annick Gouez, the daughters of Catherine Tournellec Salaün, stand at their mother's grave in Plabennec, in France's Brittany region, in June

TITLE: How one Ukrainian soldier and his wife survived 1,000 days of war with Russia
SUMMARY: Yaroslava Ivantsova and her husband, Ukrainian soldier Mykola Ivantsov, embrace at a hospital in Kyiv after he returned from being held by Russian forces as a prisoner of war

TITLE: The U.S. confirms Ukraine fired long-range ATACMS into Russia for the 1st time
SUMMARY: In this image provided by the U.S. Army, U.S. soldiers conduct live fire testing at White Sands Missile Range, N.M., on Dec. 14, 2021, of early versions of the Army Tactical Missile System. John Hamilton/U.S. Army via AP

TITLE: As Nadal plays his last tourney, Federer sends an emotional note from 'your fan, Roger'
SUMMARY: At the 2005 French Open, Roger Federer congratulated Rafael Nadal after their semifinal. Now Federer is congratulating Nadal on his looming retirement — and a stellar pro career. Nadal is playing in the Davis Cup, his final tournament, on Tuesday. Jack Guez/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Western embassies in Kyiv shut due to Russian air attack threat
SUMMARY: A boy rides a scooter past a display of destroyed Russian military vehicles in Mykhailivska square in central Kyiv, Ukraine on Tuesday, Oct. 22, 2024

TITLE: To hit deep inside Russia, Ukraine has built its own drones
SUMMARY: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy speaks with Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen on Nov. 19 in front of a drone the Ukrainians have built with funding from Denmark. Ukraine has rapidly developed an extensive drone industry that plays a critical role in the war with Russia. The inexpensive, homemade drones carry out attacks on the frontline in Ukraine and also deep inside Russia

TITLE: A Relationship Surviving 1,000 Days of War
SUMMARY: Yaroslava Ivantsova and her husband, Ukrainian soldier Mykola Ivantsov, embrace at a hospital in Kyiv after he returned from being held by Russian forces as a prisoner of war

TITLE: Romania in shock after far-right populist enters presidential election's runoff
SUMMARY: Calin Georgescu, running as an independent candidate for president, speaks to media after registering his bid in the country's presidential elections, in Bucharest, Romania, Tuesday, Oct. 1, 2024

TITLE: NATO and Ukraine to hold emergency talks after Russia's attack with new missile
SUMMARY: Russian President Vladimir Putin speaks during a meeting with the leadership of the Russian Ministry of Defense, representatives of the military-industrial complex and developers of missile systems at the Kremlin in Moscow on Friday. Vyacheslav Prokofyev/Pool Sputnik Kremlin/AP

TITLE: Putin threatens Ukraine in remarks after former-Soviet states security summit
SUMMARY: In this pool photograph distributed by the Russian state agency Sputnik, Vladimir Putin talks to the media after attending a meeting of the Collective Security Treaty Organization (CSTO) in Astana on Thursday. Ramil Sitdikov/AFP via Getty Images

SUMMARY: Irish Prime Minister and Fine Gael leader Simon Harris, center, accompanied by his wife Caoimhe and children Cillian and Saoirse, casts his vote at Delgany National School, County Wicklow, as voters go to the polls for the 2024 General Election in Ireland, on Friday

TITLE: A restored Notre Dame cathedral is unveiled days before its official reopening
SUMMARY: This photograph shows a new altar (front) designed by French artist and designer Guillaume Bardet, at the Notre-Dame de Paris cathedral, in Paris on Nov. 29, 2024. Christophe Petit Tesson/AFP via Getty Images

SUMMARY: Counting begins for Ireland's General Election at the Royal Dublin Society in Dublin on Saturday

TITLE: Over 40 people hospitalized in Georgia during protests over suspension of EU talks
SUMMARY: Demonstrators use firecrackers against police during a rally against the government's decision to suspend negotiations on joining the European Union for four years, outside the parliament's building in Tbilisi, Georgia, early Sunday, Dec. 1, 2024

TITLE: The 'magical' Advent calendar that's as big as a town hall
SUMMARY: The town of Gegenbach, Germany, turns its town hall into a giant Advent calendar each December. Hubert Grimmig/Kultur- und Tourismus GmbH Gengenbach

SUMMARY: Journalists for the British newspapers voted to strike for several days this week and next to protest the planned sale of the , the world's oldest Sunday newspaper

SUMMARY: Russian President Vladimir Putin meets with Presidential Commissioner for Children's Rights Maria Lvova-Belova in Moscow, May 31. Alexander Kazakov/Sputnik via Reuters

SUMMARY: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier (center) talks to people at the National Assembly before French lawmakers vote on a no-confidence motion in Paris Wednesday

TITLE: Nearly 500 journalists walk out at 'The Guardian' and its sister paper
SUMMARY: Journalists for the British newspapers voted to strike for several days this week and next to protest the planned sale of the , the world's oldest Sunday newspaper

TITLE: France's toppled government adds to the European Union's bigger political problems
SUMMARY: French lawmakers debate in the National Assembly in Paris Wednesday. A majority of legislators voted to oust Prime Minister Michel Barnier, forcing him to resign. Telmo Pinto/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images

TITLE: Trump receives a Paris welcome full of presidential pomp from France's Macron
SUMMARY: French President Emmanuel Macron, left, is to shake hands with President-elect Donald Trump as he arrives at the Elysee Palace, on Saturday

TITLE: Ukrainians face another harsh winter as Russia attacks coal country
SUMMARY: Evacuees from the city of Pokrovsk arrive at the train station in Pavlohrad, Ukraine, on Oct. 15. They are fleeing to cities in western Ukraine or other points in Europe. Pokrovsk, a coal mining center in eastern Ukraine, is under frequent Russian artillery barrages and aerial attacks. Michael Robinson Chávez for NPR

TITLE: Photos: Notre Dame Cathedral reopens, with its first service since a devastating fire
SUMMARY: The choir, clergy and guests stand as they sing during a ceremony to mark the reopening of the landmark Notre Dame Cathedral, in central Paris, on Saturday

TITLE: Russia targets Ukraine's energy grid as winter sets in. Here's how one plant copes
SUMMARY: Workers at the thermal power plant are rebuilding the facility after rocket strikes to restore power before winter and prevent electricity outages. Simona Supino for NPR
